ch.aplu.util

Class CheckEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.util.EntryItem
      • ch.aplu.util.CheckEntry

  • public class CheckEntry
extends EntryItem
    Class derived from EntryItem to create a check box in a EntryDialog.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CheckEntry(java.lang.String text, boolean init)
      Creates a check box with given label text and default check/uncheck sign.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CheckEntry

        public CheckEntry(java.lang.String text,
          boolean init)
        Creates a check box with given label text and default check/uncheck sign. Check boxes are displayed vertically and left aligned in the EntryPane.
        Parameters:
        text - the information text
        init - if true, the box is checked; otherwise it is unchecked

    • Method Detail

      • getCheckBox

        public javax.swing.JCheckBox getCheckBox()
        Returns the underlaying JCheckBox.
        Returns:
        the JCheckBox reference

      • getValue

        public boolean getValue()
        Returns the current state of the check box.
        Returns:
        true, if the box is checked; otherwise false

      • setValue

        public void setValue(boolean value)
        Sets the current state of the check box programmatically.
        Parameters:
        value - if true, the box is checked; otherwise unchecked

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable the button.

      • isTouched

        public boolean isTouched()
        Returns true, if check box control was hit by the mouse until the last call if this method. Any further call will return false, until the button is hit again. Puts calling thread to sleep for 1 millisecond, so it can be used in a tight polling loop.
        Returns:
        true, if the control was hit since the last call
